snippet.title: Rachel 'Bunny' Mellon, Banking Heiress And Jacqueline Kennedy Friend, Dies At 103
snippet.description: Rachel Mellon, the 103-year-old heiress who married a billionaire, befriended first ladies and queens, and redesigned the White House’s Rose Garden, died Monday morning of natural causes at her estate in Upperville, Virginia. “Had a great, long life,” said Alexander Forger, her longtime lawyer who met Mellon about 40 years ago [...] read »

snippet.title: U.S.-Japan-China Relations: With The Pentagon Making Policy, Caroline Kennedy's Confirmation Is Irrelevant
snippet.description: That DoD stepped into a policy leadership vacuum created by State’s abdication, and has been setting U.S. policy and strategy toward Asia, is the unescapable conclusion to be drawn from the recent spectacular revelations of offensive NSA cyber attacks on China. read »

snippet.title: Montblanc Celebrates 90th Anniversary Of The Meisterstück
snippet.description: The German luxury brand held an international celebrity-filled event in New York and introduced a full line of products that expresses the “spirit” of the luxury brand’s iconic writing instrument.

snippet.title: Kennedy Curse Strikes Again: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. Wife Found Dead
snippet.description: Wife of Robert F. Kennedy Jr. reportedly found dead in her New York home, one more victim in what has become known as the Kennedy curse. read »

snippet.title: The Case Against Sir Teddy
snippet.description: Why I'm niggled Gordon Brown is granting Edward Kennedy honorary knighthood. read »

snippet.title: Obama, Bush, Kennedy and More Homes of Presidents
snippet.description: For each of the U.S.' former Presidents, the most famous residence they inhabit over their lifetime is undoubtedly the big white one at 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue. But before they were elected and after they left the Oval Office, these policy makers called other addresses "home, sweet, home." In honor of [...] read »

snippet.title: Dealmaker Kennedy
snippet.description: His death marks the end of an era in Washington. Can it be revived? read »

snippet.title: Book Review: Is Edward Conard's Unintended Consequences a Scary Preview of Mitt Romney's Economic Policies?
snippet.description: For a book that purports to expose all that's false about economics, Edward Conard's Unintended Consequences gets a great deal on economics very wrong. read »
